generif.text: Increased cten mRNA expression was correlated with tumor progression in lung cancers
Cten/GAPDH mRNA expression was correlated with evidence of tumor progression in thymoma.
These results provide a novel mechanism whereby the SH2 domain of cten-mediated focal adhesion localization of DLC-1 plays an essential role in its tumor suppression activity.
Data show that EGF downregulates tensin-3 expression, and concomitantly upregulates cten, a tensin family member that lacks the actin-binding domain.
Expression of CTEN correlates with high tumor grade and metastasis to lymph nodes, suggesting that CTEN may contribute to tumor invasiveness.
TNS4 mRNA expression was significantly higher in gastric cancer.
Tensins may represent a novel group of metastasis suppressors in the kidney, the loss of which leads to greater tumor cell motility and consequent metastasis.
Cten is a novel nuclear partner of beta-catenin, and has an oncogenic activity in colon cancers.
CTEN plays an important role in paclitaxel sensitivity, and CTEN expression level may be a prognostic predictive factor for prostate cancer patients.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
CTEN (C-terminal tensin-like), a novel oncogene overexpressed in invasive breast carcinoma.
Observational study of gene-disease association, gene-environment interaction, and pharmacogenomic / toxicogenomic. (HuGE Navigator)
Cten expression is of prognostic significance in colorectal carcinoma, and delineate a Cten-ILK pathway controlling cell motility and possibly promoting metastasis.
conclude that, in the colon and pancreas, Cten is a downstream target of Kras and may be a mechanism through which Kras regulates of cell motility
Show an oncogenic role for CTEN in pancreatic cancer through promotion of colony formation and cell motility.
Phylogenetic analysis, expression patterns, and transcriptional regulation of human CTEN gene.
Up-regulated cten modulates cell migration induced by FGF2.
CTEN regulates EGFR protein levels through a posttranslational mechanism.

Findings indicate that induction of Cten protein expression is a relatively early event in melanoma progression, and that Cten has the potential to serve as a prognostic marker for primary melanoma patients.
Significant correlation between MET and TNS4 expression in human colon carcinoma and ovarian carcinoma suggests TNS4 plays a critical role in MET stability in cancer.
Cten expression mediates invasion of human lung cancer cells and is upregulated by epidermal growth factor via STAT3.
Tensin4 is up-regulated by EGF-induced ERK1/2 activity and promotes cell proliferation and migration in hepatocellular carcinoma
Conclude that in colorectal cancer, Cten is upregulated by EGFR and Kras but downregulated by STAT3.
Cten-Snail signaling pathway contributes to cell motility in colorectal cancer (CRC), mediated by the stabilization of Snail protein.
Overexpression of the TNS4 gene is a useful independent predictor of outcomes in patients with stage II/III gastric cancer who undergo surgery and receive adjuvant chemotherapy with S-1.
CTEN activated the expression of TGFB1, thereby prompting epithelial-mesenchymal transition in lung adenocarcinoma cancer cells.

Results suggest that nuclear Cten contributes to cancer cell proliferation. Findings identify a molecular mechanism for regulating Cten protein trafficking in mammalian cells and provide new insights into the dynamics of focal adhesion complexes in health and disease.
induction of CTEN reactivates focal adhesion kinase (FAK) Y(397) phosphorylation and disrupts the acini structure.
Cten may play an essential role in mediating TGF-beta1-induced EMT and cell motility and may therefore play a role in metastasis in colorectal cancer.

Src is a novel and functionally important target of the Cten signaling pathway and that Cten protein causes post-transcriptional stabilization of Src in promoting EMT and possibly metastasis in colorectal cancer

The authors propose that TNS4 plays a crucial role in CRC tumorigenesis, and that suppression of TNS4 would be an effective therapeutic strategy in treating a subset of cetuximab-refractory CRC patients including KRAS activating mutations.
analysis of cten force-induced recruitment along keratin network in epithelial cells
Investigating TNS4 in the Colorectal Tumor Microenvironment Using 3D Spheroid Models of Invasion.
Tensin4 promotes invasion and migration of gastric cancer cells via regulating AKT/GSK-3beta/snail signaling pathway.
Histone acetyltransferase p300 mediates the upregulation of CTEN induced by the activation of EGFR signaling in cancer cells.
CTEN Inhibits Tumor Angiogenesis and Growth by Targeting VEGFA Through Down-Regulation of beta-Catenin in Breast Cancer.
Mining TCGA and GEO databases for the prediction of poor prognosis in lung adenocarcinoma based on up-regulated expression of TNS4.
Nuclear-localized CTEN is a novel transcriptional regulator and promotes cancer cell migration through its downstream target CDC27.
Epigenetic Activation of Tensin 4 Promotes Gastric Cancer Progression.

name: tensin 4
summary: Predicted to enable actin binding activity. Involved in protein localization. Located in focal adhesion. [provided by Alliance of Genome Resources, Apr 2022]
